page.title: 14The Village Shop Henham
page.content: The village shop has been there for fifteen years.The post office has been in the shop for eight months.The shop faces the village ponds.Mrs Davey has been running the village shop for ten months and the post office for eight months.The shop owners keep their stock at the back in their house.In the post office seventeen pence stamps are sold most,These are first class stamps.The busiest day at the shop is Thursday.About one hundred and eighty customers use the shop a day.The most common people in the shop are children.With ladies next.People come to the shop mostly in the morning. Fresh food is sold most and drinks are popular in the summer.Frozen food is also sold.The shop is open from eight thirty am to five thirty pm.It shuts at one pm on Wednesday and Saturday.It opens on Sunday mornings.
